net.viktorc.pspp.core

Class ProcessManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.viktorc.pspp.core.ProcessManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class ProcessManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A runnable class for starting, managing, and interacting with processes. The process is started by calling the run() method.
    Author:
    A6714

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int UNEXPECTED_TERMINATION_RESULT_CODE
      If the process cannot be started or an exception occurs which would make it impossible to retrieve the actual result code of the process.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProcessManager(java.lang.String process)
      Constructs a manager for the specified process without actually starting the process.

      Subscribes a process listener to the manager instance.

      It prompts the currently running process, if there is one, to terminate.

      Removes all subscribed listeners.

      Returns whether the process is currently running.

      Removes a process listener from the manager instance if it is already subscribed.

        public ProcessManager(java.lang.String process)

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        Parameters:
        listener - The instance of ProcessListner to add.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(ProcessListener listener)
        Removes a process listener from the manager instance if it is already subscribed.
        Parameters:
        listener - The instance of ProcessListner to remove.

      • clearListeners

        public void clearListeners()
        Removes all subscribed listeners.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns whether the process is currently running.
        Returns:
        Whether the process is currently running.

      • sendCommand

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> sendCommand(java.lang.String command,
                                                  CommandListener commandListener)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to write the specified command followed by a new line to the standard in stream of the process.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to write to the process' standard in.
        commandListener - An instance of CommandListener for consuming the subsequent outputs of the process and for determining whether the process has finished processing the command and is ready for new commands based on these outputs.
        Returns:
        A #Future instance for the submitted command. If it is not null, the command was successfully submitted. If the process has not started up yet or is processing another command at the moment, no new commands can be submitted and null is returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the command cannot be written to the standard in stream.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        It prompts the currently running process, if there is one, to terminate.

         throws ProcessManagerException
